p: When subjected to oxidation using an electrochemical potential spectroscopy (EPS) protocol at 100 °C in Li three-electrode cells in 1 m LiBOB, EC/PC 1:1 vol electrolyte, the electrodes containing Mg 2Ta 2N 4 exhibited a potential profile displaying a plateau around 4.2 V versus Li +/Li and specific capacities close to 90 mA h g –1 corresponding to Δ x of virtually de-inserted Mg 2+ of about 0.7 mol. However, no significant change in the X-ray powder diffraction pattern was observed, neither after electrochemical nor after chemical oxidation, which points at the amount of Mg 2+ deintercalated being insignificant, if any, and the electrochemical capacity observed being again related to side reactions. Attempts to electrochemically reduce Mg 2Ta 2N 4 in Mg cell were not successful either.
